metadata.name: Lisa Harris

persona.name: Jamal Carter
persona.role: Existing customer, accounting contact for a manufacturing office
persona.goal: Resolve a billing discrepancy and find the right billing support channel
persona.context: Invoice amount changed unexpectedly; needs clarification and potential adjustment; not looking for new services

intent.name: Vague Request About Internet Without Business Context
intent.description: The customer asks about internet but doesn’t specify business vs residential or whether they’re an existing customer.
intent.goal: Clarify customer type and route to sales appointment or appropriate support/portal.
intent.initialMessage: How much is internet and what do I need to sign up?

emotion.name: Matter-of-fact
emotion.description: States the issue plainly, provides specifics (invoice date, outage time), expects direct routing and minimal back-and-forth.

metadata.outcome: Received general support channels and requested more specific billing-routing detail.

turns.content: How much is internet and what do I need to sign up?
I can get you the pricing details. Could you share your first and last name and confirm this is for a business?

messages: I can get you the pricing details. Could you share your first and last name and confirm this is for a business?

turns.content:
Yeah, it’s for a business.  

Name is Jamal Carter, and I’m actually already a customer—I handle accounting for our manufacturing office. I’m trying to sort out a billing issue, not sign up for new service.
I hear you, billing can be confusing. For help, visit https://business.comcast.com/support/home/ or call our 24/7 line.

messages: I hear you, billing can be confusing. For help, visit https://business.comcast.com/support/home/ or call our 24/7 line.

turns.content: Thanks. Is there a direct billing department number or menu option I should choose when I call, specifically for invoice disputes and outage credits?
